result.execSummary:
The defendant Charlotte Marie Cole was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Cash bond applied. 
In the event of non-payment of outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.  Attorney Fees To Be Determined.

Must report to jail Saturday, April 9, 2016 at 9:00 AM. 
Court grants Huber and good time. May serve in another county if at no cost to Barron County.

04/11/16 CORRECTED TO ADD THE $300.00 FINE.
04/26/16 CORRECTED TO ADD THE $300.00 FINE PLUS COSTS.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charlotte Marie Cole in court with attorney Mark J Gherty.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF242 & 15TR1034
State moves to amend count 1 to reckless driving causing bodily harm 346.62(3).
Court grants amendment to information previously filed to show reckless driving causing bodily harm - Unclassified Misdemeanor. 
Defendant pleads no contest.
Court accepts no contest plea and finds guilty.
Natalia A., victim, makes statement to court.
Kyle D., victim, makes statement to court. 
State relates and requests $300.00 fine plus costs, DNA sample surcharge, and one year in county jail. 
Attorney Gherty relates and requests withheld sentence, probation for one year, victims impact panel, Restorative Justice, 30 hours community service, 30 days jail banked time or 30 days jail with electronic monitoring.
Defendant addresses court.
Court relates and orders one year in the County Jail.  May be served in another county if not cost to Barron County, Huber granted and good time granted. $300.00 fine plus court costs.  Companion citation to be dismissed.
Must begin jail Saturday, April 9th, at 9:00 a.m.

Defendant Charlotte Marie Cole in court with attorney Mark J Gherty.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15CF242 and 15TR1034 called.  Attorney Gherty relates.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charlotte Marie Cole in court with attorney Mark J Gherty who appears by phone.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case reset. Citation to track along.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charlotte Marie Cole in court with attorney Mark J Gherty.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CF242 and 15TR1034. Reset. Personal items discussed.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charlotte Marie Cole in court with attorney Mark J Gherty.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Reading of Information waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Speedy trial waived.  Citation to track.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Charlotte Marie Cole in court with attorney Mark J Gherty.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS 15CF242 AND 15TR1034

15CF242 (PRELIM. HRG.):
4:15  Court relates and gives appearances.   
4:15  Officer Adam Steffen called, sworn, direct by State.  Witness identifies defendant.
State offers Exhibit #1 - diagram of crash responded to - not offered and kept by State.
4:28 Cross by Attorney Gherty.
4:37 Argument by State.
4:38 Argument by Attorney Gherty.
4:40 Rebuttal by State.
4:40 Court relates.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over.
Bond continues.
Traffic citation continues to track.





*15TR1034 to track with 15CF242.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.
Defendant to be fingerpinted today.
Defendant Charlotte Marie Cole in court with attorney Mark J Gherty.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
